intro: Poortmannia speciosa, commonly known as the showy poortmannia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Poortmannia speciosa is often found in rocky or forested areas, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
